alert.note: Alert for Cass; Douglas; Johnson; Otoe; Pawnee; Sarpy (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued December 15 at 3:18PM CST until December 15 at 4:45PM CST by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM CST FOR WESTERN SARPY...SOUTHWESTERN WASHINGTON...LANCASTER... SOUTHEASTERN DODGE...WESTERN JOHNSON...WESTERN OTOE...WESTERN DOUGLAS...WESTERN PAWNEE...SAUNDERS...GAGE AND WESTERN CASS COUNTIES... At 317 PM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near David City to 4 miles northeast of Hollenberg, moving east at 65 mph. THESE ARE DESTRUCTIVE STORMS. HAZARD...80 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be heavily damaged. Expect considerable damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles. Extensive tree damage and power outages are likely. Locations impacted include... Lincoln, Beatrice, Fremont, Wahoo, Gretna, Waverly, Ashland, Valley, Hickman, Wymore, Arlington, Yutan, Waterloo, Bennet, Elmwood, Cedar Bluffs, Firth, Mead, Greenwood and Palmyra. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...DESTRUCTIVE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...80 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CST for southeastern and east central Nebraska. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. This is a DANGEROUS SITUATION. These storms are producing widespread wind damage. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows.

area.areaDesc: Cass; Douglas; Johnson; Otoe; Pawnee; Sarpy
